event.title: was granted as Baker's Town after Captain Thomas Baker in 1736

data.event: While still part of Massachusetts, the town was granted as Baker's Town after Captain Thomas Baker in 1736.

event.title: was re-granted by the Masonian proprietors in 1749

data.event: It was re-granted by the Masonian proprietors in 1749 with the name Stevenstown, and settled as early as 1750.
It was re-granted by the Masonian proprietors in 1749 with the name Stevenstown, and settled as early as 1750.
Additionally known as Gerrishtown and New Salisbury, the name Salisbury was taken when the town incorporated in 1768.
